official_title: Novel Functional Anatomic and Biomarker Indices of Radiation-Induced Female Sexual Toxicities in a Multi-Center Cohort
brief_title: A Multi Center Study of Sexual Toxicities After Radiotherapy
cancer_type_display: An observational study for female patients with primary anal, rectal, cervical, uterine, vaginal, or vulvar cancer who are planned to receive pelvic radiotherapy.

locations.facility: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

key_inclusion_summary: Patients with female sexual organs, ages 18 and older.
Must have been sexually active in the 36 months prior to cancer treatment or intend to be in the 24 months following treatment.
Primary diagnosis of anal, rectal, cervical, uterine, vaginal, or vulvar cancer.
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 2 or less.
key_exclusion_summary: Planned for or have undergone extensive pelvic surgery.
Clinically or radiologically detectable widespread metastasis.
Limited life expectancy due to comorbid disease.
Personal history of cancer (other than non-melanoma skin cancer) in the last 5 years.
